六年前在PSP上第一次接触了全年龄版，通关的时候差不多是个泪人了，之后也下过pc的非全年龄的破解版，如今终于把票给补上了，也算是了却了一桩心事
当年初遇之时年纪尚小，且未接触过本篇，只是纯粹看做一篇凄美的爱情故事，为日常与结局的反差而伤心难过
后来通了本片之后再回来重温，依然哭的像当年那个孩子一样，只不过这次已经不再是单纯为这个故事了，更多的是为了智代这个人
最初的8个月，最后的三年
过了这么久我依然记着这个时间，因为它标示着智代为爱情的付出与坚守！
我至今仍旧无法想象究竟是怎样深刻的感情才会让一个人甘愿经受三年那样的痛苦，又要多么的坚强才能忍受着那样的折磨默默等候三年
默默守候着爱人的她是那么的美丽，美丽的令人心醉；独自坚守着爱情的她又是那么的坚强，坚强的令人心碎


这款《智代after》我是和本篇一起补的票，而我之所以选择在这里献上我的第一篇测评除了因为她带给我的感动外，更是因为这是我接触到的第一款文字冒险类游戏，是它为我打开了gal的大门，是她带我跳进了Key的大坑
如今的我最喜欢的作品是LB，最喜欢的角色也变成了叶留佳，而智代则已经成为了我的信仰，我希望“她”能指引着我用她教给我的坚强去守护那属于“我们”的美妙生活

最后，愿耐心看完这篇唠叨的你也能坚定的守候那属于“你们”的Wonderful Life

37174327.review:
So, I'm going to try and make this as short as possible. This game, is devastating. It crushes you. It beats you so hard, you'll feel like someone just ripped out your spine. 

But apparently, that's nothing bad. As a matter of fact, I can say that no game will ever get you this emotional. Even if you might end up with a horrible post-Clannad depression. Even if you want to kill yourself after playing this, I can't help but recommend it to anybody that ever wanted to know, how much life is actually worth. You see, this game will most likely completely take you apart, but still. In the end, you WILL realize, if you don't want that sadness in your own life, then you have to enjoy it as much as possible.

Tomoyo After is all about loss. It shows you how cruel life can be, but it also shows you that there are people that bring some light into the darkness. Yes, people like Tomoya. Always trying, always giving there best, just so others can be happy. [spoiler]And then... well the people that played it, they'll know what happens to those people sometimes. They go, one way or another. [/spoiler] But even so, what Tomoyo After is trying to say here is, you shouldn't let yourself get downed by tragedies. You always have to keep going. You have to move on, so you can expierence other happy and fun things in life. Even when it's hard, you have to keep fighting, to achive your own happiness. The happiness that can never be stolen away from you!

I know, this review didn't tell you too much about Tomoyo Afters actual content, but what exactly do you expect from a Key/Visual Arts production that is labled as a Visual Novel? Anyways, I tried to explain the way I feel about this game and why, to me, it's the most beautiful piece of art ever created. 
Peace out. Im going to hug all the Dangos in my collection now, so I may be able to gather the strength, that is necessary to leave my room after playing Tomoyo After.

36010541.review:
*- This game picks up almost immediately after the end of Tomoyo's Route in the original game CLANNAD, so if you haven't played that Route, you will be completely lost in terms of the overall context of the game, its main characters, and the various references and callbacks obviously won't make sense to you.

Also, I don't have a review for CLANNAD at the time of writing this, but I would highly recommend it; it is a quality VN with great music and varied and well written characters, and is definitely one of the better VNs on Steam. 

I'm also going to avoid mentioning really any characters names or specific plot threads from either game, as discovering those things and coming up with your own impressions is the main fun of these types of games. -*

As you might expect, I can only recommend checking out this game if you enjoyed the world of CLANNAD in general or really liked Tomoyo's character and want to continue her story.

That being said, my first annoyance with the game is that the recurring characters (Tomoya and Tomoyo) don't entirely act the same way as they did in CLANNAD. The beginning of the game shows this most glaringly. I think I mainly found it hard to believe since almost barely any time has passed since the end of the original route, so in theory the characters should be much more familiar than they are. Tomoya is a lot more forward and kinda pervy in the beginning, and Tomoyo is much more girly and has mostly lost her tomboy-ish charm. She also basically ingnores Tomoya for a good portion of the game when a certain character is introduced, which is odd considering the game seems like it wants to setup the continuation of their romance and life together. I got over it pretty quickly, but I had just finished Tomoyo's Route for the first time the previous day before starting this game, so it was a little offputting.

Which brings me to my other big problem with the game, (and I feel like CLANNAD and Air seem to have this problem as well) which is that a lot of the depressing and bad things that happen to the characters kind of fell like they are there simply because they CAN happen, rather than whether or not the SHOULD happen. I'm not saying that everything needs to always be tied up in a nice bow by the time the credits roll, but overall it feels like the the final overall tension in the plot is somewhat forced rather than organic.

Example: The tension in the original Tomoyo Route in CLANNAD makes perfect sense given what you know about Tomoya and Tomoyo by that point, so all the drama and strife that complicates their relationship and how they respond to it makes perfect sense and is totally believeable (In fact, Tomoyo's original Route is probably the most realistic/believeable one in CLANNAD). 

Those are my main issues, other than that, it is actually a really fun ride just watching Tomoya's everyday life. The side characters are decent and fun to talk to, if not lacking a little depth. The final arc of the True Ending was actually quite touching and very enjoyable, but again, I felt the actual final moments of the game with a bit half-baked and forced. In most of the endings it seemed like they were going for a "bittersweet" vibe, but really ended up feeling a bit abrupt and unsatisfying. Specifcally, the final CG "cutscene" quickly runs through a lot of really important threads that could have maybe just been expanded on in 2-3 normal VN gameplay moments to make a little less rushed.

The best thing I can say about it is that the True Ending will surely make you feeling something about it, whether that's good or bad. The overall normal day to day characters interactions are really good, but lacks some side character depth when compared to the original game.

I'm also not going to comment on the Dungeons and Takifumis (D&T) JRPG mode because A). I haven't tried it yet, and B). it's not the reason I got the game.

Ultimately, it's more CLANNAD if that's what you are looking for (which I totally was), but I personally was hoping for a little better execution of it, given how excellently done the original Route this is game is based of was. It's by no bad, but also not great. It is simply a good VN, no more, no less.

Analisis mayormente dirijido a quienes jugaron la versión original y piensan o no comprarse esta versión.

Tomoyo After ~It's a Wonderful Life~ es increible una vez que te sumerges en la historia, si ya has visto Clannad o jugado antes ésta en su Novela Visual; no te será tan dificil disfrutar desde los primeros segundos y más en esta versión en la que Tomoya tiene dialogos por voz (que de igual manera se pueden desactivar si quieres), te sentirás tan familiarizado con todo como si estuvieras viendo el anime, cosa que a mi no me sucedió del todo al inicio en la versión original de esta novela.

Hay algunas escenas censuradas que reemplazan las de la versión original totalmente, agregandole más comedia en lugar de erotismo lo cual lo hace perfecto para quienes están mirando una novela visual por primera vez y que podrían enojar un poco o no a quienes miraron las escenas originales y esperaban verlas de nuevo, en lo personal me encantó mirar este contenido nuevo y lo prefiero ya que no lo sentí tan forzado, fue adaptado muy bien sin dejar de lado la gracia de las escenas al final.

La compré y no me ha decepcionado en ningún aspecto, por lejos esta novela visual es una maquina de emociones, sentía que necesitaba algo así de nuevo después de haberme jugado la versión original hace años.

[spoiler] El final de la English Edition es más fiel a la versión del manga, lo cual lo considero perfecto para aquellos que son muy sensibles y esperaban un final feliz, en lo personal me quedo con el final real.	[/spoiler]

33207625.review:
[h1]Other Infomation[/h1]
Another great Visual Novel by Key. Finished the VN and now working on the Dungeons and Takafumis with the achievements however can say somethings about it.
No Spoilers will be in this review. No spoilers shall be left in the comments please. This is something you have to see for yourself. So no peeking at spoiler stuff.

[h1] Main Game [/h1]
I am going to leave this short by saying you need to play this for yourself to understand everything. As words cant express how amazing this story was. However don't expect it to be a long one like Clannad. As this focus on one story alone. However I will say short can be better than long and in this case; Key have done it right. Nothings dragged out and everything you see has a purpose. Treat this like an alt universe to Clannad.

There are mutiple ways this story can end. Can you find them all :D

[h1]Dungeons and Takafumis[/h1]
For this version of Tomoyo After it is unlocked from the beginning meaning you can go and dive stright into this. For other versions you had to choice certain options with Takafumis. (I don't remenber how you do this however someone will have put up a guide on unlocking this if you play a different version that doesn't give you Dungeons and Takafumis stright away)

This is a game within a game (Inception within Inception) and you play 4 of the 5 main characters as you try to clear a certain amount of floors to defeat a bad guy (I will also add that Fuko is in this however havent figured out how to get her). Takafumi will guide you through the game giving pointers and suggestions at the beginning. I havent played enough to give a great detail however it is confusing as it is fun (If I remenber there is 50 floors to beat, this will be updated when confirmed). It is styled like dungeons and dragons sort of with other elements of RPG's and Turn Based Strategys. You will get more time out of this game with this if your looking at original price to hours.

[h1]Overall Judgement[/h1]
Is it worth it? Yes. If your a fan of visual novels this is a game you shouldn't miss out on. I would recommend this to people who are looking into visual novel regardless that this is a continuation of Tomoyo's route from Clannad (Yes i've stated that this is an alt universe however so are all of the routes of Clannad apart from the main one). You won't miss much if you start here and then go back to Clannad for the rest of Tomoyo's story.

If this isn't on your list. Get it now; you will not be disappointed.

31051838.review:
[h1]An everlasting love[/h1]
Tomoyo After is the continuation of one route from the highly esteemed VN Clannad. Naturally, this story references events from the first game. Also included is an optional parody SRPG minigame.

[b]Plot[/b]
VNs live and die by the storyline so I'll discuss this first. Key is infamous for their (nukige) heart-wrenching stories and they certainly don't skimp on the drama here. The focus for most of the game lies upon newly introduced characters, giving everyone at least one arc. 

There are a handful of decisions that seem out of character for the protagonist, but he does come to realize his mistakes and reflect upon them. The actual choices given to the player are minimal and generally have obvious outcomes. A couple choices work counter-intuitively though, so don't fret over keeping a guide open to prevent yourself from getting an abrupt bad end.

Every arc connects to one another in a fluid narrative with one exception. The final arc marks a massive shift and while the transition is rough the content is well worth experiencing. Just be sure to have read the original Clannad before diving in. 

[b]Visual[/b]
A remarkable improvement from the portrait art in the prequel, even the gallery images are smartly drawn. Recycled assets are sprinkled among the newly drawn backgrounds. 

[b]Sound[/b]
Not as impacting as its predecessor, but what can possibly compare to it? The same artists worked on music in both games, so expect more somber, foreboding melodies to rain down upon you.

[b]Four stars out of five[/b]
The story meanders a bit since the focus is split between so many different characters. It's easier to empathize with the protagonist--since the final arc so sharply focuses on him, it makes the ending that much stronger.

30859640.review:
[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
	[*][b]Ending[/b] --- An unexpected surprise given the quality of everything leading up to it. Even at the cost of being almost completely disconnected from the rest of the visual novel, it ties in perfectly with Clannad, which is something the core story of Tomoyo After seemed to go out of its way to avoid at every opportunity. The premise is familiar, but not the roles. Characters regain the qualities that made them likable in the first place. The Tomoyo route comes full circle and gets as satisfying of a conclusion as possible given the nature of the setting. The only criticisms are that it's relatively brief and it wasn't better integrated into the rest of the story.
	[*][b]Dungeons and Takafumis side-game[/b] --- A small, turn-based RPG featuring the characters from the visual novel is available as optional content from the main menu.
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
	[*][b]Story[/b] --- Uninteresting and at times forced by way of characters being blatantly written as unnaturally oblivious and passive for the sake of drama. One plotline is proven meaningless upon conclusion despite some stretching to justify the whole misunderstanding. Another passes by so quickly and changes absolutely nothing for the characters involved, it may as well not have taken place.

	During the rare moments when the story is at its best, it's on par with the Clannad visual novel's weakest routes. The theme of family that is core to the series is there, but is severely underdeveloped. It's a poorly planned and executed story with misplaced focus on the wrong characters and problems. Up until the sudden turn of events towards the end, it was easy to be misled into thinking the story would conclude the same way.
	[*][b]Characters[/b] --- The main character from Clannad and Tomoyo return, although they sometimes act out of character. The brother that was a motivating factor behind the Tomoyo route becomes a permanent addition while receiving some elaboration on his past. The other few, new characters aren't compelling. One is an annoyance that not only lacks any sort of character growth but also actively detracts from the story at crucial moments, dragging it back down before it can accomplish anything.

	New characters receive poor presentation as they barge in with introductions all the while established characters put up feigned resistance to give the illusion of agency as the story pushes forward.
[/list]

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Having considered the Tomoyo storyline to be one of the best routes in Clannad, reading through the majority of Tomoyo After was disappointing. Given her situation in Clannad, it was natural for her relationship with the main character to grow impersonal as the story progressed. Retreading that path here with the role reversal could have worked, but without the engaging characters and story, it failed to be entertaining from the onset. That is up until the ending, where out of nowhere the story finally meets and exceeds all original expectations. If the journey had been anywhere near as great as the destination, Tomoyo After would have been an easy recommendation. Looking at the work as a whole, the ending alone isn't enough to make up for the slog getting there.

At a length of about [b]11 hours[/b] without taking the optional Dungeons & Takafumis RPG into account, only those that have at least completed the Tomoyo route in Clannad and enjoyed it immensely should consider picking up Tomoyo After. Even then, this visual novel is barely a recommendation and [b]should only be purchased on sale[/b] when it's heavily discounted. All others should just [b]skip reading Tomoyo After[/b].

30080348.review:
Zwykle nie interesują mnie VNki, jednak Clannad miał (ma?) specjalne miejsce w moim sercu. Dziwię się, że do jego kontynuacji podszedłem dopiero teraz. Dziwię się i żałuję, ponieważ Key stanęło na wysokości zadania i zaserwowało mi emocjonalny rollercoaster. Podobał Wam się Clannad? Spodoba Wam się Tomoyo After, które jest rozwinięciem ścieżki Tomoyo i opowiada nam historię pary T. Okazaki i T. Sakagami. Tomoya pracuje w warsztacie, gdzie naprawia sprzęd AGD, mieszka "na swoim" i wolny czas spędza z ukochaną, oraz jej niesfornym bratem. W pewnym momencie, ich zycie przewraca się o 180 stopni...by nie ocierać się o spojlery, napiszę tylko, iż cała historia, która tutaj jest opowiedziana, zakrawa o surrealizm. Wszystko dzieje się "nagle" i z dnia na dzień zaburza spokojny rytm życia wszystkich bohaterów. Dalej są już tylko emocje i więcej emocji. Powiem wprost - kiedy gracz myśli, że już wszystkie łzy uronił, że to już wszystko, że bardziej wstrząśniętym być się już nie da - Tomoyo After uderza znienacka z drugiej strony z jeszcze większą dawką emocji i ściska serca do samego końca. Po niemrawym wstępie, który ma chyba uśpić naszą czujność otrzymujemy taką bombę, która moim zdaniem ma silniejszą moc niż sam Clannad.

Owszem, nie mamy tu zbyt wielu wyborów, ścieżek - ale pamiętać trzeba, że to nie ta sama skala, co Clannad. Tutaj otrzymujemy historię krótszą, z mniejszą ilością ścieżek - ale za to z większym natężeniem emocji. Przyznam się szczerze, że nie spodziewałem się TAKIEJ historii, jaką Key mi  zaserwowało. Przy wyborze odpowiedzi nie miałem problemu - wczułem się w rolę i odpowiadałem tak, jak odpowiadałbym we własnej rodzinie. Nie ma tu wielkiej filozofii - wybory są proste i logiczne.  

W kwestii technikaliów, twórcy nie ustrzegli się kilku literówek, ale nie rażą one w oczy. Muzyka jak zwykle subtelna i trafnie dobrana do sytuacji. Voice acting również. Malkontenci przyczepią się do delikatnie zmienionego designu bohaterów - mi to nie przeszkadzało w zabawie ani trochę.  Czytania mamy na około 20 godzin, ale to nie koniec zabawy. Otrzymujemy  możliwość zagrania w tzw. Dungeons & Takafumis; jest to dodatkowa minigra, zaimplementowana do Tomoyo After, w której nasi bohaterowie przemierzają kolejne poziomy zdobywając doświadczenie, a my przy okazji dowiadujemy się trochę więcej na temat Kanako oraz Takafumiego. W wersji steam D&T dostępne jest od samego początku w menu, gdzie we wcześniejszej wersji, trzeba było ukończyć całą fabułę i w kolejnym podejściu do gry dotrzeć do konkretnego momentu, w którym owa minigra jest odblokowywana. 

Co jeszcze? Co jeszcze można powiedzieć o tytule, który w 95% skupia się na fabule, a my nie możemy jej zdradzać? Przede wszystkim: jeśli graliście w Clannad i Wam się podobał, koniecznie sięgnijcie po Tomoyo After ~It's a Wonderful Life~. [b]To jest jeden wielki wyciskacz łez. Ale jaki piękny wyciskacz...[/b]

[i]P.S. Tytuł jest okrutnie przewrotny..[/i].

29862230.review:
+ The themes in this game are much more varied than the original (even if I prefer the original), the theme of family is handled in an expert way, especially towards the conclusion where it really shines in giving Tomoyo many obstacles to overcome, just beautiful!
+ Foreshadowing was done very well, just amazing!
+ The story for the most part is great; however, I will criticize an aspect of it in my "cons".
+ Art is nice for the most part, it’s an improvement from the original though I found it less charming, still great however!
+ The use of expressions in Tomoyo After really immerse the player into the character’s phrases and actions, it's extremely well done!
+ The amount they reference the original Clannad towards the end is just a nostalgia bomb and highlight reel of what made the Tomoyo route great in the original, great experience to revisit those aspects in a new light!
+ Humor is good (not as great as the original), the comedy ranges from childish - genuinely hilarious!
+ Phenomenal ending sequence with a unique spin on "love", also a tearjerker as well...
+ Incredibly emotional
+ Tomoya was good, but the rest of the characters shined over him, specifically characters like Tomoyo and Takafumi who constantly developed in interesting ways as the story progressed...
+ Tomo is precious as a character, she's very distinct from Ushio in a good way!
+ The use of sound effects was great, they really captured great ways to make a scene comedic or sorrowful through its use of sound.
+ The OST is beautiful, not a single track I disliked, the "Main Theme" in specific is just glorious truly engrossing the reader through Tomoyo and Tomoya's relationship!
+ The environments are very well designed, they truly immerse the reader into the story Tomoyo After is trying to tell, adding to each and every thing that Tomoyo After is trying to get across through its themes...
+/- The game is short (15-20 hours), I spent most of my time playing the RPG section of D&T which was good, but had flaws, in this review I want to focus on the storytelling aspects rather than the "gameplay" aspects, to sum it up, it's average but has some nice "tidbits" to it such as references to the original and great humor with Takafumi, but the core gameplay is just “meh”, it's one of those things where you just want to fast forward to it since the gameplay is ridiculously mundane (almost purely simulated).
- Tomoya doesn't come off as a great character, he's just serviceable in this game because of how much others outshine him such as Tomoyo, Takafumi and even Kanako.
- I wish the subplots were better tied together, a lot of them feel like they either went nowhere or expect the player to fill in the blanks, whether this was the right decision or the wrong one is up to interpretation, I personally disliked it slightly...
- The beginning is good, however there were a lot of missteps, it felt very pointless to play through the first hour, felt like pure fan service and just an overall complete 180 from the themes that Tomoyo After have towards the end...
- The alternate endings are not worth getting, once you get one, you got them all, the true ending is the only one worth getting in my opinion, since it's such an amazing one...
- I do feel slightly sad that Takafumi and Kanako weren't as prevalent as I once believed towards the end of the story. Tomo too, she feels like somewhat of a missed opportunity because her character arc didn't have a definitive "end" in my opinion...

To be frank, this game has flaws, many of which are prevalent, however I feel the end completely made up for everything the game didn't accomplish, it truly does conclude in such a unique and definitive way, that honestly I just can't describe it in a way that does it justice, this is a game that must be played if you are a fan of the original, there are simply just too many things to touch upon that set this apart from the original and other Visual Novels I have played in the past. To say this was a great experience does not truly show my true feelings about the narrative, it was beyond that, it was beautiful... Overall, I'd recommend the hell out of it, though I feel I will have to give the game 2 separate ratings for its first half and 2nd half...
Tomoyo After (1rst part): 7-7.5/10
Tomoyo After (2nd part): 9.5/10
This is a must play game, especially if you're a Clannad/Tomoyo fanatic (like myself), do yourself a favor and buy it, you will not regret it...
Tomoyo truly led a "Wonderful Life"

28950126.review:
Read my full review with images here: http://aminoapps.com/p/tz0rf

2004's release of CLANNAD is one of the major examples of what makes Key such an amazing studio. It's long, and the true route (After Story) is one of the most influential stories I've read, truly changing me as a person.

Though out of all the praise I have for CLANNAD, there's one thing that really bugged me when reading. That was the differing quality between routes. Out of the 10 routes, there were about 7 that I found to be truly great. 

That may not seem bad, but when one of the routes that I found lacking ended up being a main heroine route, I can't help but feel disappointed. In case you couldn't tell, I think that Tomoyo's route is the weakest out of the 5 main routes. My main complaint is that not much happens in it. The drama is a little difficult to get through, and the first half drags on a bit much. Not to mention, Tomoyo didn't get much development, at least compared to the other heroines.

What a great thing, then, that Tomoyo recieved her very own game a year later.

[h1]Details[/h1]

Full Title: Tomoyo After ~It's a Wonderful Life~

Released: 25th November 2005

Studio: Key

Scenario: Jun Maeda

Length: 10-15 hours

[h1]Story[/h1]

We follow Tomoya Okazaki once again, but this time he's graduated from school, has his own job and lives in an apartment. Kinda like After Story, but the difference is that he is with Tomoyo this time. 

She doesn't live with Tomoya, but she and her brother, Takafumi (Best character) always visit Tomoya.

It turns out that Tomoyo has a half sister from her father's side, called Tomo (coincidence?). Tomoyo and Tomoya end up looking after Tomo due to Tomo's mother being ill, and so begins the beautiful story. I won't go further than that Synopsis, because I really don't want to spoil a single thing about this VN.

The Visual Novel has a few routes, though it is rather linear. There aren't any branching paths like other Visual Novels, rather the choices either continue the story or lead to a bad ending. This works in the Visual Novel's favour because of the length. It's about 15 hours long, and never slows it's pacing.

It feels more like an anime, because it goes from one route to another in a linear fashion. It's such an enjoyable experience.

The final arc in this Visual Novel, titled 'After' is absolutely a Masterpiece. Not only is it a throwback to the original CLANNAD, it is also a beautifully disheartening epilogue that will stay with you for a long time after you've finished it.

The ending is nothing short of incredible. If you can actually read the final text through all your tears, you will realise that it is open ended, as it doesn't give a definitive answer as to what happened. I've said it before, but these are my favourite types of endings. Ones where I can speculate as to what happened; where I can interpret it in my own way. 

Luckily, there has been a Steam release which has no H-Scenes. The steam version also contains full voice acting for Tomoya, which is awesome. I strongly recommend buying the Steam version if you want the best experience, especially if you don't like eroge. 

I think that without the H-Scenes, this story is almost flawless, and it it one of the best stories in any Key Visual Novel.

[h1]Characters[/h1]

Another thing that this Visual Novel does right is character development. There aren't many, but this means that they all get fleshed out extremely well. Even the ones that appear towards the end are great.
---
[h1]Tomoya Okazaki[/h1]

Come on, we all know who Tomoya is! He's the main character. He's sarcastic and cynical. CLANNAD taught Okazaki what it means to live, but with Tomoyo After, his development is almost the complete opposite. I like the fact that they changed how he grows as a character, because it shows us another side to him that we didn't see in the original.
---
[h1]Tomoyo Sakagami[/h1]

Our main heroine, and the titled character. I always thought that Tomoyo was extremely overrated, because she was kinda flat and boring in CLANNAD. Tomoyo After completely changed my opinion on her. Her decisions in this VN are... Questionable, but she has a lot of depth. Seeing her selfishness is detestable, though I feel that's what Jun Maeda intended.
---
[h1]Takafumi Sakagami[/h1]

Hands down, Takafumi is one if my favourite characters in all of CLANNAD. We knew a little about him in the original. We learned that he jumped off of a bridge, and became injured. Luckily he is no longer in a wheelchair here. I was a bit confused at first, but then I was like 'that's Takafumi?!' He's kind of the comic relief character but he's not dumb like Sunohara.

There are segments in this Visual Novel where you are sat in your apartment and get to choose which characters to speak to, and I always went to Takafumi.
---
[h1]Mishima Tomo[/h1]

The aforementioned half sister to Takafumi and Tomoyo. She's sees Tomoyo and Tomoya as her parents, as her real mother sort of dumped her with them. Even though she is aware of her mother's condition, she simply wants to be with her. Tomo is the main focus for most of the story, and Tomoya has a real bond with Tomo.
---
[h1]Kanako[/h1]

You can't not have a Tsundere in a Visual Novel. Joking aside, she's great. She may or may not know Takafumi from the past. I'll just say that she shares her route with him. She ran away from home because why not and lives in the Okazaki household because... Why not?

[h1]Art[/h1]

This Visual Novel came out in 2005. 2005!!! It looks incredible. Little Busters always gets praise for being ahead of its time, but this came out 2 years earlier and arguably looks even better. I can't stress enough how beautiful this Visual Novel is. Ignore the fact that it has a 800x600 resolution; it geniunely looks better than most anime that comes out nowadays.

The backgrounds are beautiful, and whilst some are recycled from CLANNAD, the new ones are incredibly detailed. Tomoya looks a bit odd though...

[h1]Sound[/h1]

The soundtrack is great. I think it's a given that a Key work will have great music, but I still have to mention it. As for the Voice Acting, it's also great. The fact that Tomoya is voiced (by the same person who did his voice in the anime) in the steam version is also a great thing.

I am a big fan of the Opening, (who isn't), and the ending song still makes those tears start flowing O_O

[h1]Final Verdict[/h1]

Please, for the love of god, play the steam 
version! It's so much better. It has a few extra scenes, cuts out the H-Scenes and has voice acting for Tomoya. If you don't happen to play the steam version for whatever reason, just skip through the first hour. You'll thank me later.

Tomoyo After is better than most other Key works, but for some reason has been left unnoticed for a long time. Not only is the story incredible, the art is also way, way ahead of it's time. I highly recommend it.

10/10

25683749.review:
SPOILER FREE REVIEW~~ STEAM KEY RECEIVED FROM KAZAMATSURI FORUM CONTEST

Tomoyo After ~It's a Wonderful Life had lofty shoes to fill. As the title suggests, it's Tomoyo's After Story. Comparisons and contrasts will inevitably be drawn with the parent visual novel's penultimate chapter. Regardless, Tomoyo After holds up remarkably well. It may not reach the heights of After Story, but it is about as close as you could feasibly get.

Tomoyo After takes place soon after the ending of Tomoyo's story in Clannad. Having resolved to spend their lives together, Tomoya works a modest job at a plant that collects broken parts and re-purposes them for better use (a subtle parallel to how Tomoya himself hopes to make better of his withered husk of a life up until now). Tomoyo visits him every day after school in his apartment. After a disappointing prologue that does little but objectify Tomoyo, the plot kicks off when Tomoyo's younger brother, Takafumi, drops some startling news on their couple; Tomoyo's father had a daughter named Tomo prior to his reconciling with his wife, and her mother has mysteriously vanished. 

From this point on, Tomoya and Tomoyo adjust to the stunning realization that they are now surrogate parents to this child in their own unique ways. Tomoyo easily slides into the role of a parent, bonding easily with Tomo by showering her with love and affection. Tomoya, initially a passive player in this change of events, hopes to prove he has both initative and resolve by finding a way to deal with an old flame of Tomoyo's by himself. Without getting in to too much detail, Tomoya admittedly decides to take some very irresponsible risks in this portion of the story, but the purpose of him doing so is laid out effectively by Maeda. Many may not find fault with it at all.

It's around this point that Tomoyo After shines. Our five main characters (Tomoya, Tomoyo, Takafumi, Tomo, and Takafumi's ex, Kanako) are an endearing group of leads who play off each other very well. Kanako's vulgar frankness interacts nicely with Tomoya's quirky imagination and contrasts effectively with Tomoyo's straight-laced, matter-of-factness. Tomoya and Takafumi's bond as brothers is also portrayed organically, with the two ribbing each other in a good-natured, heartwarming manner. Regardless of their differences, all of the cast members love Tomo and wish only the best for her. The interesting tension this causes about halfway through the story is one of the most compelling parts of the story.

The much-discussed After arc of the story is worthy of its fame. It's thought-provoking, true to the characters involved, and deeply emotional. I have a feeling it will stick with me almost as long as After Story will.

For some much needed levity, the game allows you to play an RPG minigame, Dungeons and Takafumis, a surprisingly complex and lengthy bonus that delivers good humor and (for better or for worse) challenging game design. At level 35, I've yet to finish it :P.

Tomoyo After is another solid entry from Japan's best visual novel company. If you enjoyed Tomoyo's arc in Clannad, then I would recommend this game in a heartbeat.

4.5/5

25633056.review:
Come for Tomoyo & Tomoya, stay for Dungeons & Takafumis.

If it's been said before, it's because it's true.

[EDIT 24 November for Steam Award:] 
Dungeons & Takafumis (D&T) is a minigame within Tomoyo After that is straightforwad to play and somewhat difficult to master. D&T is like a tactical RPG, except you can only give orders at the start of a battle. Once the battle starts, you lose all control of your characters - they will move around the map to follow those orders (mostly for the best, but not always). Besides the orders, you control character starting position, equipped gear, and stat growth via allocating growth points and changing jobs. 

The relatively small number of options under the player's control makes D&T straightforward to play. The difficulty is that the equipment won at the end of a battle is random. The Random Number God might give you what you need when you need it, or forsake you. The challenge in D&T is to win all battles within an in-game time limit by optimising your orders, starting positions and stat growth, while making the best use of the randomised equipment.

A few observations from this game.

4. The art's a bit different then the original. It's not enough to take you out of the story, but it's enough to make return players feel like something's off.

    选项分支比一般主流galgame少一些，流程也不算长，严格意义上说确实更像是一个galgame里的一条线。虽然很多人建议先玩本篇再玩儿这个游戏但其实游戏和本篇的关联很少，基本上只要了解一下智代那部分的背景就可以了。

    小游戏鹰文与地下城才是这游戏的精髓,（你看成就有多少跟它有关的就知道了...）当年很爱玩儿的这个小游戏。为了刷成就才玩了这么久。然后发现两个坑爹的地方，一个是原先全职业技能学习是不需要限定在一个人的，结果我学完了并没有跳成就，开始以为是我有的职业没学满就转了直到最后我查指南才发现说必须一个角色学满== 另外我明明把朋也练到99级了，结果还是没达成那个成就不知道是什么原因...辛辛苦苦肝了这么久太让我失望了，难道那百分之一点几的都是用的Sam么==

    总结一下就是老司机买不买看情怀，新人如果喜欢clannad，又喜欢智代线的话可以尝试下，第一次玩儿自带纸巾哦。

24198178.review:

24197763.review:
这其实是我第一次玩《智代 after》，因为没有玩过之前的版本，所以只能大概说下自己对这个版本的体验和感受。和前作相比的具体变化，我不怎么清楚，有些只能是搬运网上查的资料。
(如果您想节约时间的话，可以直接看这里：情节时而欢快幽默，时而感人励志。游戏分成好几个故事，互相有联系。游戏很棒，无论是否是「智代」粉都很值得玩一下。P.S.游戏多少有些致郁，请备好眼药水）

[h1]1.和18X版本的区别[/h1]
据我从论坛了解，目前这款作品是基于Memorial Edition制作的，而不是18X版，这版本有什么特点呢？
（*）游戏前篇里的ooxx都被换成了Cosplay。所以一些绅士可能要失望了。:P
（*）游戏包含了全结局，就是有所谓的Good Ending了。不过还是会挺虐，而且这Good Ending改得有点牵强，简单说，就是改得不彻底，和前面剧情衔接有些问题。
（*）智代的cv嘛，还是和《智代 after》原版一样是「田中凉子」，而不是《CLANNAD》中的「桑岛法子」，让我比较失望。而「朋也」的配音和动画里一样是由「中村悠一」配的。（之前的PC版，据说「朋也」是没有配音的）

[h1]2.智代的人物性格变化挺大[/h1]
如果你之前没玩过这部作品，只是单纯因为喜欢《CLANNAD》中的「智代」而想入这款游戏的话，你可能会有些失望。
       因为《智代 After》里的「智代」可以说和《CLANNAD》的「智代」完全是两个人。为什么这么说呢。《CLANNAD》中的「智代」是很成熟的，虽然是「朋也」的后辈，但看上去更像是「朋也」的学长。「朋也」就像是一个弟弟被姐姐照顾着。乐观，开朗，直爽，就像一汪清泉，可以看到池底，像个小太阳，让人暖到心里。而《智代 After》里的「智代」呢，喜怒无常，突然就大嗓门吼起来了。而且那发飙时候的「智代」人设不忍直视。《智代 After》里的「智代」，更依赖她的男朋友，不像《CLANNAD》中那么独立有主见。夸张点说的话，这两个女孩只是碰巧都叫「智代」而已，不是同一个女孩。虽然和《CLANNAD》有一些剧情上的联系。
当然，我并不是说这部作品里的「智代」不好，只是她和《CLANNAD》中的「智代」在性格上有很大不同。这部作品中的「智代」我同样很喜欢。
       另外，不像《CLANNAD》还有《CLANNAD Side Story》这另两款在Steam上发行的作品，那两款都是高清重制的，界面很漂亮。这款作品没有高清化，只是作了英语翻译。界面相对来说也比较简陋。

[h1]3.故事和人物刻画[/h1]
       除却前面的吐槽，这部作品的故事，人物刻画还是很棒的。为了不剧透，我只能说游戏正篇才开始就让我想哭，人物心理的描绘很真实，让我想起了自己小时候。游戏更多的是让你自己去感受，自己去思考，而不是像很多连续剧那样给你讲一堆大道理。但光这样，很难让人继续玩下去。总不能一把鼻涕一把泪地点着鼠标把游戏打通，对吧？所以和《CLANNAD》中一样，中间穿插着各种搞笑和无厘头。其中最能搞笑的是「河南子」，相当于《CLANNAD》中的「春原」。个人很喜欢，配音好听，虽然是个暴力女，但是会撒娇，又会搞笑。
       整个主线是由好几个故事构成，每个故事的主角都会发生变化，比如开始是「智代」的妹妹，然后是「河南子」跟「鹰文」，最后回到「朋也」和「智代」。除去地下城内容，20小时游戏内容是肯定有的。
       另外，游戏中每天都会用一小段时间来记录「朋也」的工作。记录他每一天的努力，进步。虽然很平常，但这让朋也这个人物更丰满。就像一个网友说的，这家伙太努力了，把所有脑袋中那些不可能完成的目标都完成了，导致最后遭报应了。
       在《CLANNAD》的「智代线」中，更多的都是「智代」在付出，而这里，可以看到「朋也」有多爱「智代」。为了「智代」付出了很多，很多...
      一些老玩家，对这部作品评价不好，说结尾是强行喂屎，剧情衔接不顺畅，没有铺垫。的确，玩到最后是有那么点味道，但是这新版本修改后，好了不少，已经补了不少剧情，最后还是可以接受的。

[h1]小游戏：鹰文与地下城[/h1]
游戏开始，选项里就有《鹰文与地下城》直接可以玩，不像原版，这里不需要推进剧情开启，这可以算是一个额外的小游戏，比较简陋，比较像红白机那会的RPG吧。跳格子的。虽然这么说，但是有些成就还是挺难拿的。（补充一下：终于拿完全成就，有些成就很需要运气，看我游戏时间就知道了，剧情看完二十多小时，剩下的时间就是在那刷。之前游戏有bug，不能获得那个全职业技能的成就，现在修复了，需要全成就的话，看下攻略会好很多）

[h1]总结：[/h1]
       从VN的角度来说，这部作品的质量还是很高的。虽然比不上《CLANNAD》，但是碾压《CLANNAD Side Story》还是很轻松的（毕竟外传都不是原作者写的嘛）。题外话，《CLANNAD Side Story》不是信仰粉的话可以先别入，因为每个故事其实都可以算是同人故事，作者都不同的，而且都很短，大概二十分钟左右。
       最后，如果你只是单纯喜欢「智代」，那这部作品可能会让你有些许失望，因为这作的「智代」没有《CLANNAD》里的那么有魅力，但是把它当成普通的VN来玩的话，那绝不会让你失望。

A wonderful romance story following the story in Clannad if you followed Tomoyo's route (which you should have, it is the best route in my opinion)

This visual novel has funny, likeable characters and a great story. While the VN is not as long as Clannad (explains the low price in comparison) It does have multiple routes you can follow to get many different endings based on the choices you make.
I, for one, am glad they decided to bring this to Steam. I did own the uncensored H-version originally, and I decided to uninstall that in favor of this one, as in my opinion, the H-scenes add nothing to the game and honestly make Tomoyo and Tomoya act drastically out of character. The alternate scenarios they used to replace the scenes are more enjoyable and some made me laugh (If I want porn, that's what google is for. I can live without it in my reading materials thank you).


All in all this is well worth the full price, and even better on sale (was $15 on launch with the 20% discount).
I can't reccommend this game enough, sadly there's only a thumbs up and not a big flashing neon YES! button.

If you decide this isn't the kind of game for you, that's fine. Hopefully you find one that suits you.

If you like romance, Clannad/Little Busters!/KARAKARA/ and Tomoyo after is a good choice.

Mystery/Detective? Steins;Gate(not on steam at the time of this review) and even most definitely Danganronpa 1+2 are excellent choices.

Action? Fault;Milestone 1 and 2.



Feel free to add me if you have any questions or just wanna chat it up. I am always up for either.

24113047.review:
～信者にとってはまさに神ゲー、信仰の篤さが問われる名作～

本作は当時、麻枝准最後の作品と謳われた傑作である。
そしてそのシナリオこそ麻枝信教の集大成にして最高の経典であることは間違いないであろう。

智代の苗字「坂上」とは「高みへ上っていく」象徴、臆面なく言ってしまえば「坂の上の雲」の象徴として名づけられたものである。
最強、最高の理想像として描かれた彼女と、そのパートナーとしての生き様（アフター）とはかくあるべきであろうか。

作中で一貫して語られるのは、ひたむきに理想や目的へと向かう努力、その一点に尽きる。
そしてその先に報われる未来――It's a Wonderful Life――これこそが我々が目指せよと教えられた世界である。

この愚直とも言えるほどにストレートで強烈なメッセージの塊であるシナリオ群を通して、どうして本作の評価は二分されようか。
敬虔なる信者は心を打たれ希望彩る世界に感涙し、一方で理解に苦しむ庶民は単調な活劇にただ辟易するのみである。

さて、諸兄にとって”Wonderful Life”とははたしてなんであろうか…今こそ問われよう。



しかし本作の評価のほとんどを占めるのがＤ＆Ｔ（インストール直後からいきなり遊べちまうんだ！）のそれである事実は、実績が物語ること必至なのであった…

24074813.review:
[h1]「人 生 の 宝 物 探 し に い こ う」[/h1]
It's finally here! Tomoyo After ~It's a Wonderful Life~ is finally on Steam! The tagline for this visual novel has been on my Steam profile description for as long as I can remember and while this VN is short, it has a powerful impact which I think is much more powerful than CLANNAD. Even so, CLANNAD and Tomoyo After still works on the same premise: the importance of family.

Tomoyo After ~It's a Wonderful Life~ is the spin-off to the highly acclaimed visual novel CLANNAD which picks up where Tomoyo route ended in CLANNAD. Developed by Key back in 2005, this VN was originally released as 18+ eroge thus why the voice actor for Tomoyo is different and the art direction is slightly different than how it was in CLANNAD. This time around Key didn't use Sekai Project to publish their game, instead they publish it under VisualArts brand while the translation is handled by another company using Doki's translation as a base (probably). Nevertheless, thx based Doki.

Tomoyo After picks up few months after Tomoyo's route ended in CLANNAD. Tomoya now works in a local workshop fixing home appliance while Tomoyo is now in her Senior Year. After the problem between Tomoya and Tomoyo in CLANNAD, the couple promise to be more forward with each other so they can overcome all the problem in life no matter how hard it is. One day, Takafumi, Tomoyo's younger brother, brought a young girl named Tomo which turns out to be the sibling's illegal stepsister. Takafumi, not wanting the Sakagami family to be torn apart again, decided to make Tomo live with Tomoya. Tomo is living happily with Tomoyo and Tomoya, despite that she still wants to be with her mother, thus began the journey to find Tomo's mother and the reason why she abandons Tomo to the Sakagami family.

Without giving too much spoilers, Tomoyo After follows on its tagline [b]「Let's look for the treasure of life」[/b] by taking us on a journey of how Tomoyo overcoming her weakness with the help of Tomoya while Takafumi have to face the consequences of what he had done in CLANNAD and the burden that his choice has put upon him. Tomoya himself also wants to prove that he is no longer the person that he was back in his high school days and show the world that the love between him and Tomoyo are [b] eternal [/b] and cannot be broken by anything for their power of love will overcome all troubles.

The art for Tomoyo After was directed mainly by Fumio and not by Hinoue, thus why Tomoyo looks similar but visibly different from how she was in CLANNAD. While Hinoue might not be the main art director like how she was in CLANNAD, she still helps with the character design. Everything else was handled in-house by Key with another notable thing to note is that Kashida Leo, a new scenario writer for Key, helped Maeda Jun in making the scenario for Tomoyo After.

The VN will take about 15-20 hours to finish depending on your reading speed. The VN alone is worth the current pricetag that it carry. But it doesn't stop there! As if the epic closure for Tomoyo story is not enough, they put an icing on the cake with Dungeon & Takafumi! A tactical role-playing game centered around the game that Takafumi is currently developing along with his overseas friend. It is time consuming and quite fun once you get the hang of it plus it has its own story centered around Takafumi and Kanako, Takafumi's girlfriend. On that note, I kinda dislike the fact that the Steam version lets you to play D&T even when starting Tomoyo After for the first time instead of unlocking it through the choice that you made while conversing with Takafumi in the VN.

Since this VN has many revision and re-release, I actually managed to read this VN multiple times across multiple version across multiple console. I will list all the edition here + the platform I read them on while also adding a comparison of what each version have and don't have.
[olist]
[*][b]The Original release[/b]: Played on PC, 18+ eroge.
[*][b]CS (Consumer Software) Edition[/b]: Played on PS3, All-Ages. Retconned the "bad" ending in Original release because everyone hates it while adding voice acting for Tomoya. I prefer the Original release ending rather than the retconned ending since it delivers a much more impactful ending than the one in CS Edition but I guess everyone is entitled to their own opinion. Also I never platinum this Edition because I don't like playing RPG on my couch.
[*][b]Memorial Edition[/b]: Played on PC, this edition is basically CS Edition but for PC since the CS Edition only released on console.
[*][b]Perfect Edition[/b]: Played on PC, includes all the content in Memorial Edition with added 18+ scene, but removed Tomoya's voice acting.
[*][b]English Edition[/b]: Played on PC via Steam. This Edition is based on the Memorial Edition of Tomoyo After. [b][u]Remember[/u][/b], this is [u][i]English Edition[/i][/u] so it make sense that it won't be translated to other language.
[/olist]

Closing my review, I strongly suggest that you read CLANNAD before picking up Tomoyo After or at least have watched Tomoyo-hen otherwise you will be lost as to what is going on in the story. This visual novel is definitely a must have if you're love Tomoyo like I am or if you want to delve further into the CLANNAD universe.

24025251.review:
It's a Wonderful Life!

《智代アフター ～It's a Wonderful Life～》是由Key社开发的十八禁恋爱文字冒险游戏，Windows版本发行于2005年11月25日。剧情讲述的是Key社作品《Clannad》中智代线的后续发展。Key社随后又推出了全年龄版本。移植PS2，PSP，Xbox 360,PS3平台的游戏名称为《智代アフター ～It's a Wonderful Life～ CS Edition》。本作目前登陆Windos,PS2,FOMA,PSP,Xbox 360,PS3,Android多个平台，同时具有多个游戏版本。本作拥有衍生漫画作品《智代AFTER》。

本作主题围绕智代以及《Clannad》中周围的关键角色而发展，将《Clannad》中的女主角之一扩展，根据线路选择给予了新的故事和剧情，实际上象征着《Clannad》中智代线的延续，坂上智代的性格特征也进行了柔化，着重描写了和朋也交往后心理和性格发生的改变。

在游戏中，玩家扮演本作男主角冈崎朋也，同时也是《Clannad》的男主角，通过阅读剧情和不同角色之间的对话，作出各种各样的选择，最后根据玩家的决定按照特定的线路前进，具有多种结局。想要体验全部结局，就必须要作出各种各样的尝试。在全年龄版本的游戏中删除了十八禁相关内容。

游戏中包含一个额外RPG游戏，“Dungeons＆Takafumis”鹰文与地下城，玩家通过特定选项可以解锁该小游戏，在小游戏中，玩家需要获取和升级自己的武器装备，提升人物等级，利用游戏中出现的人物在地下城中对抗怪物，最后通关小游戏和小游戏中的相关操作都可以解锁相应成就。

本作的登场人物：
冈崎朋也
主角，同时也是《Clannad》的主角，在废品回收公司工作，和智代交往，同居。
坂上智代
女主角，冈崎朋也的女友，性格较《Clannad》中发生改变，非常关心男主，喜欢小孩。

เป็นเรื่องธรรมดาของมนุษย์ที่คุณจะมีชีวิตที่หวานขมปนเศร้า แต่ในชีวิตอันหวานอมขมกลืนนั้น มันก็มักที่จะเจือไว้ด้วยความสวยงามที่เมื่อระลึกถึงก็ทำให้คุณอดคิดเสียมิได้ว่า ฉันไม่เสียใจสักนิดที่ได้ลืมตาเกิดมาบนโลกใบนี้ โลกนี้ช่างสวยงามจริง ๆ

ถ้าให้อธิบายถึงอารมณ์ที่ได้สัมผัสกับ [b] Tomoyo After ~It's a Wonderful Life ~ [/b] ก็คงจะเป็นประโยคที่เปี่ยมไปด้วยความหวังเช่นนี้ล่ะนะ

[b] สำหรับแฟนบอยผู้ที่เคยได้สัมผัสเกมนี้มาก่อน: [/b]

สำหรับคอ Visual Novel แล้ว เกมนี้ก็คงจะเป็นเกมที่ออกจะคุ้นเคยดีอยู่หรืออย่างน้อยก็คงจะรู้จักชื่อ เพราะตัวเกมมีอายุอานามอยู่มากพอสมควรและผมเชื่อว่าชาวเกมเมอร์ส่วนใหญ่ก็คงจะได้เคยมีโอกาสกันมาก่อนแล้ว ซึ่งถ้าคุณคิดสงสัยว่าควรจะซื้อเก็บไว้เป็นที่ระลึกหรือไม่ ผมก็ขอให้ข้อมูลช่วยประกอบการตัดสินใจว่า Tomoyo After ~It's Wonderful Life~ English Edition นี้ก็คือ Memorial Edition ที่ถูกแปลมาเป็นภาษาอังกฤษ ดังนั้นตัวเกมจึงไม่มีฉาก 18+ หรืออะไรเทือกนั้น แต่ตัวเกมก็มีฉากเพิ่มเติมเข้ามาและมีการให้เสียงครบทุกคำทุกพยางค์ ณ ตอนนี้ไม่แน่ใจจริง ๆ ว่าจะมีใครใจดีช่วยปล่อย Perfect Edition มาเป็น Mod ในภายหลังหรือไม่ แต่ถ้าคุณไม่คิดที่จะใส่ใจฉากพวกนั้น ด้วยราคาเต็มเป็นเงินบาทก็ยังถือได้ว่าเกมอยู่ในช่วงที่คุ้มค่าน่าสะสมครับ

[b] สำหรับใครอื่นที่เพิ่งจะเคยได้ยินชื่อเกมนี้: [/b]

ถ้าใครที่เคยได้มีโอกาสชมหรืออ่าน Clannad มาก่อน (มีวางจำหน่ายบน Steam แล้วถ้าคุณเผลอตกข่าวไป) คุณก็คงจะคุ้นเคยกับ Tomoyo เป็นอย่างดี (แต่ถ้าไม่ก็ขอให้ย้อนกลับไปเล่น Route ของเธอใน Clannad ก่อนเพื่อความฟิน ส่วนตัวผมเองไม่ค่อยจะแนะนำให้กระโดดข้าม) เกมนี้ก็คือ "After Story" ที่เป็น Route ที่มีเธอเป็นตัวเอก

อารมณ์ของ Tomoyo After ค่อนข้างจะแตกต่างไปจาก Nagisa After อยู่ไม่น้อย เพราะ Tomoyo เป็นตัวละครที่แตกต่างจาก Nagisa แบบสุดขั้ว โดยในครานี้ Tomoya จะเข้าไปมีส่วนพัวพันกับปัญหาดราม่าอันเกิดจากคนใกล้ตัวของ Tomoyo โดยตัวละครใหม่ (ที่น่าจดจำมาก ๆ) ทั้งสามที่เราจะได้พบก็คือ Takafumi ผู้เป็นน้องชายของ Tomoyo, Tomo ผู้เป็นน้องสาวต่างมารดาของเธอ และ Kanako เด็กสาวปากเสียผู้ที่รู้จักกับ Takafumi ดังนั้นเนื้อเรื่องในคราวนี้จึงมี Tomoyo เป็นศูนย์กลางโดยเล่าผ่านมุมมองของ Tomoya จริงอยู่ที่ว่า Tomoyo ที่เราจดจำได้เป็นสาวแกร่งและฉลาด แต่ใน After Story นี้ เราก็จะได้มีโอกาสรู้จักมุมมองของเธอที่ต่างออกไปโดยเฉพาะในด้านที่บอบบางและความเป็นผู้หญิงของเธอมากขึ้น

ถ้าคุณเป็นคนหนึ่งที่ชอบ Clannad และ Tomoyo ล่ะก็ "Tomoyo After ~It's a Wonderful Life~ English Edition ก็คือหนึ่งในเกมที่คุณไม่ควรพลาด เพราะมันจะทำให้คุณเสียน้ำตาได้มากพอ ๆ กับที่คุณเสียให้กับแม่หนู Ushio ครับ

ข้อดี:
+ ดราม่าโศกสลดบีบน้ำตา ที่ทำให้คุณรู้สึกอบอุ่นหัวใจไปด้วยในเวลาเดียวกัน
+ เพลงประกอบที่ยังคงยอดเยี่ยมไม่แพ้กันกับภาคหลัก
+ Tomopedia ที่เหมือนสารานุกรมขนาดพกพาที่ช่วยให้คุณเข้าใจวัฒนธรรมบางจุดของชาวญี่ปุ่นได้มากขึ้น
+ โหมด Dungeon & Takafumis อันเป็นโหมดแฟนตาซีเฮฮา ไม่สลักสำคัญนัก แต่ก็เล่นได้พอขำ ๆ และเต็มไปด้วยมุข

ข้อเสีย:
- ตัวเกมไม่ได้ถูกปรับแต่งมาให้รองรับความละเอียดหน้าจอแบบ HD ถ้าคุณเล่นแบบเต็มจอก็คงจะต้องทนกับแถบดำขนาบข้าง

24004965.review:
[b]Tomoyo After[/b] - это альтернативный сиквел [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/324160/]Clannad[/url], являющийся продолжением ветки Томоё. Если вы не проходили оригинальную новеллу или не смотрели аниме по ней, то очень советую начать именно с неё, иначе вы многого не поймёте.

[h1]О возникновении и развитии игры[/h1]
Как вы уже знаете, главной героиней Clannad была Нагиса и внутренний сиквел (After Story) был только про неё. Но из-за огромной популярности Томоё, разработчики решили сделать альтернативный вариант After Story, на этот раз с Томоё.

В 2005-ом выходит оригинальная версия игры. Игра была 18+ (с порнухой), но по общему мнению фанатов порно-сцены были сделаны очень неудачно и не к месту, да и вообще портили образ Томоё. В 2007-ом на PS2 выходит новая версия, получившая приписку CS Edition. Игра была сильно переработана: из неё убрали порно, но сюжет сильно расширили, увеличив продолжительность истории примерно в полтора раза. В 2007-ом выходит порт на PSP, в котором появляется озвучка главного героя, таким образом игра впервые стала полностью озвученной. И вот в таком виде (с расширенной историей и озвучкой главгероя) игра перекочёвывает обратно на ПК, получая приписку Memorial Edition. После этого в неизменном виде игра получает ещё несколько портов, а в 2014-ом на ПК выходит новая версия - Perfect Edition. По сути это та же Memorial Edition, в которую вернули порнуху из оригинальной версии, но из которой выпилили озвучку главгероя.

[h1]Про версию для Steam[/h1]
Благодаря усилиям Sekai Project сначала [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/316720/]Planetarian[/url], а затем и [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/324160/]Clannad[/url] вышли в Стиме. Западный релиз этих игр оказался настолько успешным, что VisualArts/Key решили выйти в Стим самостоятельно. Они уже анонсировали для Стима практически весь свой каталог и вот перед нами их первый самостоятельный релиз - Tomoyo After.

Как нетрудно догадаться, Steam-версия игры сделана на основе Memorial Edition. В ней нет порнухи, зато есть полная озвучка, включая главного героя. Помимо стандартного набора плюшек из Memorial Edition, английская версия получила Томопедию - энциклопедию по некоторым моментам, которые могут быть непонятны для иностранцев. Над переводом работали авторы фанатского первода оригинальной версии. В своё время из-за технических сложностей они не смогли разобрать и перевести Memorial Edition. Но в прошлом году VisualArts/Key сами вышли на них и предложили сотрудничество. Собственно, Steam-версия - это результат совместной работы фанатской группы и оригинального разработчика.

[h1]Брать или нет?[/h1]
Если вы фанат Clannad - брать обязательно. Если вы любите добротные визуальные новеллы, которые заставляют плакать даже Валуева - тоже можно брать. но сначала возьмите Clannad. Clannad стоит дорого, но она ОЧЕНЬ длинная, примерно в 2 раза больше "Войны и мира", к тому же во время распродажи ценник на неё вполне доступный. Ну, или хотя бы посмотрите анимешку, в отличие от многих других адаптаций, она сделана очень добротно. Аниме-сериала вам вполне хватит, чтобы начать играть в Tomoyo After.

24003562.review: Let's look for the treasure of life.

24000974.review:
I know I just purchased this game, but I played the unofficial English translation about 3 years ago, so I already know how amazing this VN is.

Tomoyo After is a branching plot line from Tomoyo's Route in the original Clannad Visual Novel. It's more or a less a "What if" scenario if Tomoya had formed a relationship with her instead of Nagisa. So yes, it is highly recommended you play her route from Clannad first before playing this game. It will really help you to understand the characters background, and other characters that were mention in her route in Clannad and make an appearance in Tomoyo After. 

Now I must say, Tomoyo is a more independent charismatic character compared to Nagisa. Now I like both characters, but Tomoyo is far more enjoyable. Tomoya and Tomoyo have some really good exchanges in dialogue that really make the relationship feel "real". The supporting cast is interesting as well, with plenty of time given to them for their subplots to have satisfying conclusions, while also adding to the main plot of the story. 

Also, my favourite part of the game is the soundtrack. My favourite song being the main title theme song called "Hope", and its played a few times throughout of the entire game. If your heart strings get pulled when you think of Dango Daikazoku from Clannad, then just prepare that they will be ripped entirely when you finish the game and listen to Hope. Honestly, this is strongly based on my opinion but I think Tomoyo After has very amazing ending that really will pulse out a large array of emotions towards you. It is in many ways, bitter sweet. 

So yes! If you are a VN fan, and certainly a Clannad fan, pick this game up for sure. It will not disappoint, it is truly amazing, and 100% my favourite VN to date. Support Key, and hopefully we will see Little Busters next.

39380866.review:
A massive disappointment. If this were a route in Clannad, it'd be easily the worst written of them all. It reads like bad fan fiction, full of absurd contrivances, cliches and established characters acting out of character for the sake of creating drama. The entire scenario set up is so poorly conceived that the world they live in fails to resemble any sort of convincing reality, and moreover they undo the character development established in Clannad. The few things that do work well in this game, such as its humor and music don't do anything to save this game. 

I did not finish this and I don't intend to - it just gets worse the further you get into the game. If you want more Clannad or more Tomoyo, just replay that instead, or find some bad fan fiction, which will cost less.

39276603.review:

Now, I do feel like the characters are a little differently portrayed, but I've to come to my own conclusion for that. That being, well obviously Tomoya and Tomoyo change each other as they live on. People change. I still believe their core personalities are there. I really enjoyed this story, it brought me to tears more so than Clannad at one point. It's hard to judge which had the most impact the first time though... The music is wonderful in this one too, and it will amplify your emotions if your into it. Props to Key on this one too. 

Also, there's a funny RPG mini game included with this VN. I didn't get too much into it, but it looks like they put a decent effort into it. 

Enjoy!

I been hearing for a long long time that Tomoyo After It's a Wonderful Life is a very bittersweet but powerful story and I kept those thoughts to heart, and finally after finishing Clannad and Clannad Side Stories I finally got to experience this and I have to say right now: this got me right in the heart in a more stronger way than Clannad did. Little backstory this is a vn based on after the events of Tomoyo's path in Clannad but this might be a spoiler to say but just in case you wish to know: there is only 1 or 2 mentions of characters from Clannad in this and some references to Tomoyo's events in there too. Other than that I do believe you could still give this a read even if you have not read Clannad yet or ever (though I highly recommend you do cause they are great).  I think my only negatives about Tomoyo After is there wasn't much characters in this like less than 5 or 6 compared to Clannad and it's not a short vn but about like half as long as Clannad like you could finish this in less than 9 to 10 hours or even 5. But I don't think those would damage the experience cause the story itself overall I think was well written but as I alluded it's very tragic and bittersweet which kinda makes sense cause I believe Jun Maeda his original vision for Clannad was to have a tragic and bittersweet end to the story but his colluges talked him into writting a happy ending to Clannad which I think was fair but that's a debatable topic so no need to go there, but regardless it seems that original goal he was able to get it somehow into this story which ok I will not spoil the ending at all but I will say it made me cry a lot more than Clannad and hence it's the reason why people say Tomoyo After is more sadder than Clannad. Anyway so to end this how does this to me hold up compared to Clannad? Is it better than Clannad? Is it not? To me I believe this is great on it's own and it's up there with Clannad.I give Key so much applause to making this story that isn't even canon but still makes a great story involving a very interesting character (their favorite too btw true story Jun wanted to make this cause he loves Tomoyo lol). I gave Clannad a 10/10 and I didn't say this for my Side Stories review but I give that maybe a 8/10 but as for Tomoyo After It's a Wonderful Life, I give this a 9/10. It's a very good visual novel I highly recommend it and I urge to those who are interested in all three of these vns please do get the bundle it'll be worth it. Just one last thing to send this off: remember do not give up on finding your treasure, your meaning of life. The path can be rough but know you're not alone in this and someday you will find it. Be strong and never fall into despair and stand and walk tall and proud. Have a wonderful life.
